page.title: 10Early History Of Upton.
page.content: It is likely that there was a settlement at Upton in prehistoric times already practising settled farming and trading when the{Romans arrived in AD 43, but the first recorded mention was in a late 8th century document when King Coenwulf of Mercia granted land at Upton to the Abbey at Winchcombe. In 962 a Charter of Oswald, Bishop of Worcester gave six hides of land at Upton to his Thane Cynelm. In the{Domesday Book Upton is part of the Manor of Ripple (ton = area of land, up = up from Ripple). Sometime after{1066 King {William}granted areas of land to his followers and trade with France and Europe increased. Upton became important as a centre on a tidal river with adjacent land producing exportable goods. An annual fair and weekly market was held in Upton.
